0.question:
Ken was trying to sell his house. Ken was frustrated because it had been a very long process. Ken sat and thought about why no one wanted it. He thought it was a great house , he had a lot of good memories there. Ken decided to keep the house.
Which is more likely?
(a) Ken would likely take the house off the market and stop trying to sell it.
(b) Ken would likely take the house off the market and stop trying to sell it because people seem to be more interested in purchasing other properties in the neighborhood.
0.target_answer: Ken would likely take the house off the market and stop trying to sell it.

1.question:
Our family loves to eat pasta. We serve pasta for dinner at least three times every week. Last week, I forgot to set the timer and the pasta was overcooked. We thought dinner was ruined, but it actually tasted better that way. Now we always cook pasta for 2 extra minutes.
Which is more likely?
(a) The protagonist would set the timer for 2 extra minutes when cooking pasta.
(b) The protagonist would set the timer for 2 extra minutes when cooking pasta because they prefer their pasta slightly overcooked.
1.target_answer: The protagonist would set the timer for 2 extra minutes when cooking pasta.

2.question:
Jonathan was a silly type of man. He lived out in the wilderness in his parents Trailer. One day Jonathan  decided to show up at his friend's house. His friend was caught by surprise. Jonathan settled in at his friends for a movie night together.
Which is more likely?
(a) Jonathan would likely bring some snacks or drinks to share with his friend for their movie night.
(b) Jonathan would likely bring some snacks or drinks to share with his friend for their movie night because his friend had mentioned being out of snacks earlier that day.
2.target_answer: Jonathan would likely bring some snacks or drinks to share with his friend for their movie night.

3.question:
Kia was walking along the breakwall by the sea. Her mom walked on the ground beside her. She urged Kia to get down before she fell in the water. At first Kia refused, but then she stumbled and almost fell! After that, she hopped down willingly!
Which is more likely?
(a) Kia would listen to her mom and get down from the breakwall.
(b) Kia would listen to her mom and get down from the breakwall because it was clear that staying up there was dangerous.
3.target_answer: Kia would listen to her mom and get down from the breakwall.

4.question:
Edgar was donating blood at the blood bank. He was very nervous because he did not like needles. However, he wanted to impress a girl. When the nurse showed him the needle, he passed out. Edgar was very embarrassed and did not go back.
Which is more likely?
(a) Edgar would likely avoid going back to the blood bank.
(b) Edgar would likely avoid going back to the blood bank because he associates it with fainting and embarrassment.
4.target_answer: Edgar would likely avoid going back to the blood bank.
